trans-unit.source: How to use io.js with Azure App Service Web Apps
trans-unit.target: How to use io.js with Azure App Service Web Apps

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use a web app in Azure App Service with io.js.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use a web app in Azure App Service with io.js.

trans-unit.source: How to use io.js with Azure App Service Web Apps
trans-unit.target: How to use io.js with Azure App Service Web Apps

trans-unit.source: The popular Node fork [io.js] features various differences to Joyent's Node.js project, including a more open governance model, a faster release cycle and a faster adoption of new and experimental JavaScript features.
trans-unit.target: The popular Node fork [io.js] features various differences to Joyent's Node.js project, including a more open governance model, a faster release cycle and a faster adoption of new and experimental JavaScript features.

trans-unit.source: While [Azure App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) Web Apps has many Node.js versions preinstalled, it also allows for an user-provided Node.js binary.
trans-unit.target: While [Azure App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714) Web Apps has many Node.js versions preinstalled, it also allows for an user-provided Node.js binary.

trans-unit.source: This article discusses two methods enabling the use of io.js on App Service Web Apps: The use of an extended deployment script, which automatically configures Azure to use the latest available io.js version, as well as the manual upload of a io.js binary.
trans-unit.target: This article discusses two methods enabling the use of io.js on App Service Web Apps: The use of an extended deployment script, which automatically configures Azure to use the latest available io.js version, as well as the manual upload of a io.js binary.

trans-unit.source: Using a Deployment Script
trans-unit.target: Using a Deployment Script

trans-unit.source: Upon deployment of a Node.js app, App Service Web Apps runs a number of small commands to ensure that the environment is configured properly.
trans-unit.target: Upon deployment of a Node.js app, App Service Web Apps runs a number of small commands to ensure that the environment is configured properly.

trans-unit.source: Using a deployment script, this process can be customized to include the download and configuration of io.js.
trans-unit.target: Using a deployment script, this process can be customized to include the download and configuration of io.js.

trans-unit.source: The [io.js Deployment Script] is available on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: The [io.js Deployment Script] is available on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: To enable io.js on your web app, simply copy **.deployment**, **deploy.cmd** and **IISNode.yml** to the root of your application folder and deploy to Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: To enable io.js on your web app, simply copy **.deployment**, **deploy.cmd** and **IISNode.yml** to the root of your application folder and deploy to Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: The first file, **.deployment**, instructs Web Apps to run **deploy.cmd** upon deployment.
trans-unit.target: The first file, **.deployment**, instructs Web Apps to run **deploy.cmd** upon deployment.

trans-unit.source: This script runs all the usual steps for a Node.js applicaion, but also downloads the latest version of io.js.
trans-unit.target: This script runs all the usual steps for a Node.js applicaion, but also downloads the latest version of io.js.

trans-unit.source: Finally, **IISNode.yml** configures Web Apps to use the just downloaded io.js binary instead of a pre-installed Node.js binary.
trans-unit.target: Finally, **IISNode.yml** configures Web Apps to use the just downloaded io.js binary instead of a pre-installed Node.js binary.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To update the used io.js binary, just redeploy your application - the script will download a new version of io.js every single time the application is deployed.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To update the used io.js binary, just redeploy your application - the script will download a new version of io.js every single time the application is deployed.

trans-unit.source: Using Manual Installation
trans-unit.target: Using Manual Installation

trans-unit.source: The manual installation of a custom io.js version includes only two steps.
trans-unit.target: The manual installation of a custom io.js version includes only two steps.

trans-unit.source: First, download the **win-x64** binary directly from the [io.js distribution].
trans-unit.target: First, download the **win-x64** binary directly from the [io.js distribution].

trans-unit.source: Required are two files - **iojs.exe** and **iojs.lib**.
trans-unit.target: Required are two files - **iojs.exe** and **iojs.lib**.

trans-unit.source: Save both files to a folder inside your web app, for example in **bin/iojs**.
trans-unit.target: Save both files to a folder inside your web app, for example in **bin/iojs**.

trans-unit.source: To configure Web Apps to use **iojs.exe** instead of a pre-installed Node version, create a **IISNode.yml** file at the root of your application and add the following line.
trans-unit.target: To configure Web Apps to use **iojs.exe** instead of a pre-installed Node version, create a **IISNode.yml** file at the root of your application and add the following line.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: In this article you learned how to use io.js with App Service Web Apps, using both provided deployment scripts as well as manual installation.
trans-unit.target: In this article you learned how to use io.js with App Service Web Apps, using both provided deployment scripts as well as manual installation.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] io.js is in heavy development and updated more frequently than Node.js.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] io.js is in heavy development and updated more frequently than Node.js.

trans-unit.source: A number of Node.js modules might not work with io.js - please consult [io.js on GitHub] for troubleshooting.
trans-unit.target: A number of Node.js modules might not work with io.js - please consult [io.js on GitHub] for troubleshooting.

trans-unit.target: What's changed

trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: [Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529714)

trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: [Reference for navigating the preview portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529715)

trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751), where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.
